title: Updates to FragmentController.
message:
Updates to FragmentController.

Abstract away the title/subtitle stuff into a new class FragmentInfo.
FragmentController now isn't supposed to care about the title/subtitle
of the fragment, it just gets a FragmentInfo blob to use. It's now up to
MainActivity to set the title and up button and so on appropriately.
FragmentController is just meant to organise which fragments get shown
when.

FragmentInfo also includes an ID which identifies a fragment to the
level of "looks the same". This allows us to make sure the same fragment
is never pushed twice in a row. This lives in FragmentController now for
convenience, even though it really belongs in MainActivity.

title: General tidying of FragmentController.
message:
General tidying of FragmentController.

Also fix a bug we would have seen if the root view had a slave. Add a
couple of TODOs for the remaining work.

title: Add support for up + back instead of just back=up.
message:
Add support for up + back instead of just back=up.

Code needs some tidying, but the interactions actually seem pretty nice!
Idea is that each fragment has a "level" and a "slaveness" (at the
moment this is represented by odd vs even levels). When you push a
fragment, if its level is the same as the level of the current leaf then
it stays at the same hierarchy level, and either replaces the whole
screen (if it's a master) or just the right (if it's a slave). Back
goes back in time. Up goes back until the level changes. Note that the
actual numerical ordering of the levels is irrelevant.

title: Fix up fragment lifecycle.
message:
Fix up fragment lifecycle.

Before we were opening cursors in onActivityCreated and closing them in
onDestroy, but that's wrong -- onActivityCreated can be called multiple
times for a fragment between onCreate and onDestroy.

title: Remove BaseColumns.
message:
Remove BaseColumns.

Instead, specify a numeric _ID for each table, and set this as the
auto-generated rowid field in the databases. Remove the explicitly
generated _id fields that were there before.

Have adapters specify which columns they need, so that external things
don't need to worry about the columns at all. To get around the fact
that there's no _id column any more, select the _ID column as "_id".

The _ID columns are the ones that should be used for identification in
code, since querying by this column is fastest. This isn't all done yet.

title: Make the database actually load again.
message:
Make the database actually load again.

A few commits ago I removed some code that got a cursor and then did
nothing with it (in SplashActivity). Turns out this was force-opening
the database, and therefore causing it to be created. This change opens
it in a more legit way.
